chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: The coookbook provides a series of example queries and show you how they can be built in the query builder. A basic knowledge of the query builder is assumed (e.g. how to add navigate the model browser, add a constraint and select fields for your results output). If you are not familar with these then please see the tutorials first.

sect1.title: How do I find which GO terms my gene has been annotated with?
sect1.para: A template query is available for this query:
Gene --> GO terms, which can be accessed via the 'Gene Ontology' aspect.
To build this query in the query builder:

listitem.para: Select the class from which you will start building your query: from the query builder tab on the home page, select 'Gene'.
Constrain the Gene class to the Gene of interest by adding a constraint to either the Gene identifier, symbol or organismdbid.
Select the 'Summary' button next to 'Gene' to add the key gene fields to your output. Alternatively use the 'Show' buttons to select individual fields that you would like to see in your results.

Looking down the list of classes in the model browser you will notice one called 'allGoAnnotation' and one called 'goAnnotation'. The goAnnotation class holds only the deepest level GO term annotation (ie the primary annotation assignment). The allGoAnnotation class holds all the parents of the primary annotation assignment as well. So, depending on whether you want to return only the most specific GO terms or the most specific GO terms and all of the parents of these GO terms, you will choose either the goAnnotation class or the allGoAnnotation class respectively. If you expand each of these classes (using the '+' to the left of the class name), you will see that the fields available are the same for both. Click on 'show' next to 'idenitifer' and 'name' to return the GO annotation identifier and name. Alternatively click on 'summary' to return the key fields.
Run the query by pressing 'Show Results'.
